I sanctioned yesterday the Legal Framework of Early Childhood, actions for protection and childcare, with emphasis on the first 6 years of life.
Brazil recognizes the importance of childhood because there are the foundations of the development of the person.
We seek to reduce inequalities in access to goods and services from birth.
The Legal Framework reinforces the Brazilian State's role in childcare begun in 2012 with the launch of #BrasilCarinhoso.
The Legal Framework also provides for the possibility of increasing the paternity leave of 5 p / 20 days. An achievement for the whole Brazilian society!

PM speaking @vauxhall on why the UK is better off in a reformed Europe.
PM: There is going to be lots of debate about Europe over the coming months.  But the biggest issue on 23rd June is our economic future.
PM: I know people want to understand more about Europe & the Single Market. Let me take you through 3 big advantages of the Single Market.
PM The first big advantage of the Single Market is that British businesses can sell to a continent of customers – 500m people – tariff-free.
Dormitory conditions Darul Falah in Federal Hill is less satisfactory and will be improved https://t.co/QgjhN73mU2 https://t.co/sjHmwm23SH
PM: Secondly the Single Market doesn’t just eliminate tariffs, it eliminates other barriers to trade - what are known as non-tariff barriers
PM: Thirdly, the Single Market enables the EU to strike the most ambitious and comprehensive trade deals with the world.

PM: Looking at what experts say, the way evidence points & what makes our people better off, I believe we should remain in a reformed Europe

I’ve been setting out the 3 big advantages of the EU single market at @vauxhall in Ellesmere Port. (1/5)
First, the single market means British businesses can sell to a continent of customers – 500m people – without paying costly tariffs. (2/5)
Second, the single market has scrapped other barriers to trade, including endless paperwork & expensive technical rules. (3/5)
Third, the single market lets the EU strike the most ambitious & comprehensive trade deals with the world. (4/5)
As Bank of England governor Mark Carney said, leaving the EU is “the biggest domestic risk to financial stability”. (5/5)
